sen.j: 西院駅は、京都市右京区 西大路四条にある、阪急電鉄・京福電気鉄道の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Nishioji Shijo, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Saiin Station and Sai Station are stops that are operated by the Hankyu Railway and the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co.,Ltd, respectively.
Located in Nishioji Shijo, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Saiin Station and Sai Station are stops operated by the Hankyu Railway and the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., respectively.
Located in Nishioji Shijo, Ukyo Ward, Kyoto City, Saiin Station and Sai Station are stops operated by the Hankyu Railway and the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., respectively.

sen.j: 阪急の場合は「さいいん」、京福電気鉄道の場合は「さい」と読む。
sen.e: 西院' is pronounced as 'saiin' for the Hankyu Railway and 'sai' for the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co.,Ltd.
西院' is pronounced 'saiin' for the Hankyu Railway and 'sai' for the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
西院' is pronounced 'saiin' for the Hankyu Railway and 'sai' for the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: なお、周辺の地名の、公的なひらがな表記は「さいいん」であり、最近はこのとおり発音されることが多いが、以前、地元では京福電気鉄道の駅名と同じく「さい」と発音されることが多かった。
sen.e: Incidentally, the official description in hiragana for '西院' around this area is 'さいいん,' pronounced as 'saiin,' which is common recently; in the past, however, most local people would pronounce '西院' as 'sai' like the station name of the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co.,Ltd.

Incidentally, the official description in hiragana for '西院' around this area is 'さいいん,' and lately it has taken the pronunciation 'saiin'; however, in the past most local people would pronounce '西院' as 'sai,' like the station name of the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

Incidentally, the official description in hiragana for '西院' around this area is 'さいいん,' and lately it has taken the pronunciation 'saiin'; however, in the past most local people would pronounce '西院' as 'sai,' like the station name of the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 「さい」と「さいいん」の混交形などと思われる、「さいん」「さあいん」などという発音も聞かれる。
sen.e: Some people pronounce '西院' as 'sain' or 'saain,' which is assumed to be resulted from combinations of 'sai' and 'saiin.'
Some people pronounce '西院' as 'sain' or 'saain,' which is assumed to have resulted from combinations of 'sai' and 'saiin.'
Some people pronounce '西院' as 'sain' or 'saain,' which is assumed to have resulted from combinations of 'sai' and 'saiin.'

sen.j: 大阪方面から鹿苑寺等へ向かう観光客や、立命館大学等へ通う通学客が、当駅を乗換駅に用いることが多い。
sen.e: The stations are generally used as transfer stations by the tourists from Osaka area visiting Rokuon-ji Temple etc. or commuters going to Ritsumeikan University etc.
The stations are generally used as transfer stations by tourists from the Osaka area visiting Rokuon-ji Temple, etc., or by commuters going to Ritsumeikan University, etc.
The stations are generally used as transfer stations by tourists from the Osaka area visiting Rokuon-ji Temple, etc., or by commuters going to Ritsumeikan University, etc.

sen.j: 阪急電鉄
sen.e: Hankyu Railway
Hankyu Railway
Hankyu Railway

sen.e: Hankyu Kyoto Line (Saiin Station)
Hankyu Kyoto Line (Saiin Station)

sen.j: 京福電気鉄道
sen.e: Keifuku Electric Railroad Co.,Ltd
Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 京福電気鉄道嵐山本線（さい駅） A3
sen.e: Arashiyama Main Line (Sai Station) A3
Arashiyama Main Line (Sai Station) A3
Arashiyama Main Line (Sai Station) A3

sen.j: 所在地は右京区西院高山寺町38-1。
sen.e: The address of Saiin Station is 38-1, Saiin Kozanji-cho, Ukyo Ward.
The address of Saiin Station is 38-1, Saiin Kozanji-cho, Ukyo Ward.
The address of Saiin Station is 38-1, Saiin Kozanji-cho, Ukyo Ward.

sen.j: 駅舎、改札口は地上の西大路四条交差点の南西角に設けられている。
sen.e: The station building and the ticket gate are aboveground, located at the south-west corner of the intersection of Nishioji Shijo.
The station building and ticket gate are aboveground, located at the southwest corner of the intersection of Nishioji Shijo.
The station building and ticket gate are aboveground, located at the southwest corner of the intersection of Nishioji Shijo.

sen.j: プラットホーム形状と配置2面2線ホームの地下駅で、四条通の真下にホームがある。
sen.e: Saiin Station is an underground station with two platforms serving two tracks (the form of platform and its arrangement); the platforms are just under the Shijo-dori Street.
Saiin Station is an underground facility with two platforms serving two tracks; the platforms are just under Shijo-dori Street.
Saiin Station is an underground facility with two platforms serving two tracks; the platforms are just under Shijo-dori Street.

sen.j: 現在の駅舎を建設する際、大阪方面行ホーム東端付近（地下）から京福電鉄西院駅前（地上）までの地下通路と改札口が新たに計画され整備されていたが、地元商店街の反対により、結局、使用中止となった過去がある。
sen.e: When the current station building was constructed, the constructions of an underground passage connecting the east end of the platform for Osaka (underground) and Sai Station that is operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co.,Ltd, and a ticket gate were newly planned and were proceeding; however, the constructions were eventually halted due to the opposition by the local people working in the local shopping areas.

When the current station building was constructed, the construction of an underground passage connecting the east end of the platform for Osaka (underground) and Sai Station, as operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., and a ticket gate had been planned and put to work; however, the construction was eventually halted due to opposition by the local people working in the local shopping areas.

When the current station building was constructed, the construction of an underground passage connecting the east end of the platform for Osaka (underground) and Sai Station, as operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd., and a ticket gate had been planned and put to work; however, the construction was eventually halted due to opposition by the local people working in the local shopping areas.

sen.j: そのため、地下通路へ通じる出入口は現在閉鎖されている。
sen.e: Accordingly, the entrance through to the underground passage is now closed.
Accordingly, the entrance to the underground passage is now closed.
Accordingly, the entrance to the underground passage is now closed.

sen.j: 尚、河原町駅から伸びる地下路線は西院と西京極の間で地上路線に続く。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the underground passage extending from Kawaramachi Station connects to the aboveground passage between Saiin Station and Nishikyogoku Station.
Meanwhile, the underground passage extending from Kawaramachi Station connects to the aboveground passage between Saiin Station and Nishikyogoku Station.
Meanwhile, the underground passage extending from Kawaramachi Station connects to the aboveground passage between Saiin Station and Nishikyogoku Station.

sen.j: 関西で始めて完成したこの地下路線は土木遺産に指定されており、 出口上の額には「天人併其功」の文字がかかれている。
sen.e: This underground passage, the first passage completed in the Kansai region, is designated as the Civil Engineering Heritage; there is a frame for the characters of '天人併其功' ("Tenjin sono ko wo awasu") hung above the exit of the passage.

This underground passage, the first to be completed in the Kansai region, is designated as a Civil Engineering Heritage; over the exit of the passage there is a frame for the characters '天人併其功' ("Tenjin sono ko wo awasu").

This underground passage, the first to be completed in the Kansai region, is designated as a Civil Engineering Heritage; over the exit of the passage there is a frame for the characters '天人併其功' ("Tenjin sono ko wo awasu").

sen.j: 地下路線創建時につくられた鷲のレリーフが、運行の安全を見守っているといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that the relief of eagle created when the underground passage was constructed has been watching over the security in train operation.
It is said that the relief of an eagle, created when the underground passage was constructed, has continued to watch over the security of train operations.
It is said that the relief of an eagle, created when the underground passage was constructed, has continued to watch over the security of train operations.

sen.j: 所在地は中京区壬生仙念町16。
sen.e: The address of Sai Station is 16, Mibu Sennen-cho, Nakagyo Ward.
The address of Sai Station is 16, Mibu Sennen-cho, Nakagyo Ward.
The address of Sai Station is 16, Mibu Sennen-cho, Nakagyo Ward.

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: The station is the aboveground station with two separate platforms serving two tracks.
The station is an aboveground facility with two separate platforms serving two tracks.
The station is an aboveground facility with two separate platforms serving two tracks.

sen.j: 当駅より北に50m程進んだところに車庫がある。
sen.e: There is a depot 50 m away from the station in the north.
There is a depot 50 meters north of the station.
There is a train depot fifty meters north of the station.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。

sen.j: 駅近くの踏切は、遮断機はないが、踏切警報機が設置されている。
sen.e: The crossing near the station does not have the crossing gate, but the crossing alarm is installed.
The crossing near the station doesn't have a crossing gate, but a crossing alarm is in place.
The crossing near the station doesn't have a crossing gate, but a crossing alarm is in place.

sen.j: 市街地で交通量の多い場所でこの踏切は珍しい。
sen.e: This type of crossing is not common for the busy area in the city.
This type of crossing is unusual for such a busy area of the city.
This type of crossing is unusual for such a busy area of the city.

sen.j: また、この警報音が鐘で鳴らされているので、鉄道ファンのスポットにもなっている。
sen.e: Since the alarm is the sound of bells, many railway fans visit the crossing to hear the sound.
Because the alarm emits the sound of bells, many railway fans visit the crossing just to hear the sound.
Because the alarm emits the sound of bells, many railway fans visit the crossing just to hear the sound.

sen.j: この駅を起終点とする列車が早朝・深夜を中心に運行されている。
sen.e: Sai Station is the first and last station for the trains operated mainly in the early morning and late-evening.
Sai Station is the first and last station for the trains that operate mainly in the early morning and late evening.
Sai Station is the first and last station for the trains that operate mainly in the early morning and late evening.

sen.j: 平成17年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は阪急電鉄が約21,246人、京福電気鉄道が約1,208人（京都府統計書より推定）。
sen.e: The number of passengers per day in 2005 was about 21,246 at Saiin Station operated by the Hankyu Railway; about 1,208 at Sai Station operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co.,Ltd (estimated from Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book).

The number of passengers per day in 2005 was approximately 21,246 at Saiin Station, operated by the Hankyu Railway; and about 1,208 at Sai Station, operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd. (as estimated from the Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Book).

The number of passengers per day in fiscal year 2005 was approximately 21,246 at Saiin Station, operated by the Hankyu Railway; and about 1,208 at Sai Station, operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd. (as estimated from the Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report).
sen.cmt: 「京都府統計書」の表現を統一しています。fiscal → fiscal yearに変更しました。

sen.j: 阪急の駅は、新京阪鉄道の京都側の暫定的なターミナルとして開業した。
sen.e: The station of the Hankyu Railway was opened as a temporary terminal on the Kyoto side of the Shinkeihan Railway.
The station of the Hankyu Railway was opened as a temporary terminal on the Kyoto side of the Shinkeihan Railway.
The station of the Hankyu Railway was opened as a temporary terminal on the Kyoto side of the Shinkeihan Railway.

sen.j: その時は地上駅で頭端式ホームの駅だった。
sen.e: At that time, the station was an aboveground station with toothed platforms.
The station was then an aboveground facility with toothed platforms.
The station was then an aboveground facility with toothed platforms.

sen.j: 京阪電鉄合併後の1931年に京阪京都駅（現在の大宮駅）まで延伸された際、地下化された。
sen.e: In 1931, after being merged into the Keihan Electric Railway, the station was extended to Keihan Kyoto Station (Omiya Station) and made underground.
In 1931, following its merger into the Keihan Electric Railway, the station was extended to Keihan Kyoto Station (Omiya Station) and moved underground.
In 1931, following its merger into the Keihan Electric Railway, the line was extended to Keihan Kyoto Station (Omiya Station) and the station was moved underground.
sen.cmt: （駅ではなく）線路が大宮まで延伸された、としました。

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）3月25日 嵐山電車軌道（現在の京福電鉄嵐山本線）の西院駅開業。
sen.e: March 25, 1910: Sai Station of the Arashiyama Electric Tramway (the current Arashiyama Main Line that is operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co.,Ltd) was opened.
On March 25, 1910, Sai Station of the Arashiyama Electric Tramway (the current Arashiyama Main Line, operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.) was opened.
March 25, 1910: Sai Station of the Arashiyama Electric Tramway (the current Arashiyama Main Line, operated by the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.) was opened.

sen.j: 1918年（大正7年）4月2日 会社合併により京都電燈の駅となる。
sen.e: April 2, 1918: The station came to be operated by the Kyoto Dento as a result of amalgamation.
On April 2, 1918, the station came under the operation of Kyoto Dento as a result of amalgamation.
April 2, 1918: The station came under the operation of Kyoto Dento as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月1日 新京阪鉄道（現在の阪急京都本線）の京都西院駅開業。
sen.e: November 1, 1928: Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway (currently Hankyu Kyoto Line) was opened.
On November 1, 1928, Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway (currently the Hankyu Kyoto Line) was opened.
November 1, 1928: Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway (currently the Hankyu Kyoto Line) was opened.

sen.j: 1930年（昭和5年）9月15日 新京阪鉄道京都西院駅が、会社合併により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: September 15, 1930: Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway became a stop operated by the Keihan Electric Railway as a result of amalgamation.
On September 15, 1930, Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway came under the operation of the Keihan Electric Railway as a result of amalgamation.
September 15, 1930: Kyoto Saiin Station of the Shinkeihan Railway came under the operation of the Keihan Electric Railway as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1931年（昭和6年）3月31日 京阪電気鉄道京都西院駅が地下化され、同時に西院駅に改称。
sen.e: March 31, 1931: Kyoto Saiin Station of the Keihan Electric Railway was made underground and renamed Saiin Station at the same time.
On March 31, 1931, Kyoto Saiin Station of the Keihan Electric Railway was moved underground and renamed Saiin Station.
March 31, 1931: Kyoto Saiin Station of the Keihan Electric Railway was moved underground and renamed Saiin Station.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）3月2日 京都電燈西院駅が、路線譲渡により京福電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: March 2, 1942: Sai Station of the Kyoto Dento was transferred to the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co.,Ltd.
On March 2, 1942, Sai Station of the Kyoto Dento was transferred to the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.
March 2, 1942: Sai Station of the Kyoto Dento was transferred to the Keifuku Electric Railroad Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 京阪電気鉄道京都西院駅が、会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（現在の阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: October 1, 1943: Kyoto Saiin Station of the Keihan Electric Railway came to be operated by the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.
On October 1, 1943, Kyoto Saiin Station of the Keihan Electric Railway came under the operation of the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1943: Kyoto Saiin Station of the Keihan Electric Railway came under the operation of the Keihanshin Express Railway (the current Hankyu Railway) as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1980年代前半までホーム有効長が7両分しかなかったため、8両編成の列車は上り・下りとも進行方向最後尾1両のみドアカットを行っていた。
sen.e: Since the entire length of the effective platform was equal to only 7 cars until the early 1980s, trains comprised of 8 cars (both inbound and outbound trains) had to keep the doors of the last car closed at the station in the direction of travel.

Because the entire length of the effective platform was equal to only seven cars until the early 1980s, trains that consisted of eight cars (both inbound and outbound trains) had to keep the doors of the last car closed at the station in the direction of travel.

Because the entire length of the effective platform was equal to only seven cars until the early 1980s, trains that consisted of eight cars (both inbound and outbound trains) had to keep the doors of the last car closed at the station in the direction of travel.

sen.j: 現在は10両の有効長となっており、朝ラッシュ時に何度か使用されている。
sen.e: At present, the entire length of the effective platform is equal to 10 cars, which is sometime used in the morning rush.
Today, the entire length of the effective platform is equal to ten cars, as occasionally used during the morning rush.
Today, the entire length of the effective platform is equal to ten cars, as occasionally used during the morning rush.
